required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PFMT Educational Intervention for Patients With Advancer Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Pelvic Floor Muscle Training Educational Intervention for Patients With Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: A PFMT educational intervention was designed for women with metastasic breast cancer. It consisted in a 120 min workshop and 8 weeks of non-supervised (but with follow-up) self-training. ICIQ, IQOL and ad hoc questions were performed before the workshop and after the 8 weeks training to see the prevalence of UI, the impact in their quality of life and the empowerment of self-training.

detailed_description.textblock:
Urinary incontinence (UI) affects women of all ages and has a great impact on the quality of life. Cancer treatments such as chemotherapy or hormone therapy may play an important rol in the development and worsening of pelvic floor disorders. Little evidence on the prevalence and impact of UI in metastassis breast cancer women is known.
A protocol was designed to analyze the effect of a PFMT educational intervention on the UI and the impact on the QL, as well as in the empowerment feeling of the participants.
During the usual visits, oncologist wil recruit women with advanced breast cancer who meet the inclusion criteria for the participation.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence and severity of urinary incontienece
Changes in prevalence and severity of urinary incontienece

secondary_outcome.measure: impact on the quality of life
changes in impact on the quality of life
questionnaire on changes of knowledge and empowerment

arm_group.description: PFMT educational intervention including a 120 min workshop and 8 weeks of self training

intervention.description: an educational intervention to learn about the pelvic floor and how to train it

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Advanced breast cancer
- Over 18 years old
- ECOG≤2
- No inestable bone metastasis
- life expentancy>6 months
- Literate in spanish
Exclusion Criteria:
- Physical exercise contraindications
- Intense pain
- Being pregnant
